title: Trump Revises Stance on Ukraine, Backs Territory Reclaim with NATO Support
snippets: Last month, President Trump said Ukraine needed to be open to giving up some of its territory in peace talks with Russia. But those talks haven't happened. Now, he says Ukraine could win it all back.
The US president says Ukraine can win back land with support from Nato and Europe, marking a major shift in his position.
Trump previously said both Kyiv and Moscow would have to cede land to end Europe's deadliest war since World War II.

<a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMiekFVX3lxTE9ISERQbzZDaV96TXlsaXZ6NG1keUdBMnU2OTY2Rmw0SHVpdWxBZUoySUszSF9XWmFmSEdTYXdLMVRDM3p1RENCSjJyX1RQdkxQNjV3OTNnTW5EZEFSdUZxQU5UU0c1bERMSTJBd3REQlJxLW9mWWswbm1n?oc=5" target="_blank">In extraordinary shift, Trump says Ukraine can win war with Rus
Zelenskyy thanked Trump for his efforts to bring an end to the war.
US president signals change of stance and suggests Kyiv, with support from Europe and Nato, can restore its old borders

US president claims Russia is in ‘big economic trouble’ as he calls for Nato countries to stop imports of Russian oil

  • US politics live – latest updates</
President Trump’s pivot could give him room to distance himself from a conflict that he once promised to solve in days or weeks.
titles: Trump, in major shift, suggests Ukraine can win back territory long held by Russia
Kyiv can win all of Ukraine back from Russia, Trump says
In major shift, Trump says Ukraine can win back all territory from Russia
In extraordinary shift, Trump says Ukraine can win war with Russia - Axios
Trump admin live updates: In major shift, Trump says Ukraine can win back seized land
Trump says Ukraine can win back all of its territory seized by Russia
Trump says he believes Ukraine can regain all land lost to Russia since 2022 invasion
In a Sudden Shift, Trump Says Ukraine Can Win the War With Russia
summary: President Trump has shifted his stance on the conflict between Ukraine and Russia, now stating that Ukraine can reclaim its territory with support from NATO and Europe. This marks a significant change from his previous position, where he suggested both Kyiv and Moscow might need to cede land to end the conflict. Trump's updated view aligns with increased assistance for Ukraine and suggests a strategic distance from the conflict, which he once claimed he could resolve quickly. Ukrainian President Zelenskyy has expressed gratitude towards Trump for his efforts to end the war.

title: Man Convicted for Attempted Assassination of Trump, Faces Life Sentence
snippets: Jurors convicted Routh on five charges, including last year's attempted assassination of Trump as he golfed at his South Florida course. Routh represented himself in court and faces life in prison.
A US jury finds that Routh intended to kill then-presidential candidate Donald Trump last September.

<a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMihAFBVV95cUxQdEpTbnphd2daQU16UVd1Qzg3dWpNakFRS3dldEg3LVJWbFdITUd2dVNBT3FtM1oxbGEzM25tRlI5OWtyUG1HaFgwTzB2NVZHVFVXLWNHbl9ieGhJbXNWVG9ybTU5ZXVQd1BoUVBjbVJpZVZNM1BTQXJLRlNCekpfc0lxSkc?oc=5" target="_blank">Ryan Routh found guilty in Trump assassination a
Ryan Routh, the man accused of trying to assassinate President Donald Trump on his West Palm Beach golf course last year, has been found guilty on all five counts.

Routh represented himself in trial over botched attempt on Trump’s life at West Palm Beach golf course

The man accused of trying to assassinate Donald Trump on his West Palm Beach golf course two months before Trump clinched his
Routh attempted to stab himself in the neck with a pen after the guilty verdict was delivered.
titles: Jury convicts Ryan Routh on all charges in attempted assassination of Donald Trump
Ryan Routh found guilty of attempting to assassinate Trump in Florida
Ryan Routh found guilty in Trump assassination attempt - Axios
WATCH:  Ryan Routh guilty on all counts in Trump golf course assassination attempt
Ryan Routh found guilty of 2024 attempted assassination of Trump in Florida
Ryan Routh Found Guilty Of Assassination Attempt On Trump—Then Tries To Stab Himself
summary: Ryan Routh was convicted on five charges, including the attempted assassination of Donald Trump at a South Florida golf course last year. Representing himself in court, Routh now faces a life sentence. The jury concluded Routh intended to kill Trump during the incident. After the verdict, Routh attempted to stab himself in the neck with a pen.

title: OpenAI and Oracle Launch $500B Stargate AI Project in Texas
snippets: <a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMiekFVX3lxTE10cjBrMDkxZWZWbU1jekZrN3RrVklkTldxWGJSMG44eEdOcmVicXhSTTgzNU4wNmIxdS1zSVNiN1JsbTRiSjFsNjktX19GMFdkdk1XQmdwWFprQ3kybUZzOGZhN3h0VGw3UmNJU3pfUi13ZTlfeEctbEZB?oc=5" target="_blank">OpenAI announces five new sites for Stargate data center projec
OpenAI and Oracle are betting big on America's AI future, bringing online the flagship site of the $500 billion Stargate program in Abilene, Texas.
The agreements will take the cost of the high-profile data centre initiative to $400bn
OpenAI is continuing to build out massive AI data centers to train and serve increasingly powerful AI models.
titles: OpenAI announces five new sites for Stargate data center project - Axios
OpenAI's first data center in $500B Stargate project is open in Texas, with sites coming in New Mexico and Ohio
OpenAI expands Stargate AI project with five US sites
OpenAI is building five new Stargate data centers with Oracle and SoftBank
summary: OpenAI, in partnership with Oracle, has launched the flagship site of the $500 billion Stargate project in Abilene, Texas, marking a significant investment in the future of American AI. This initiative, which aims to expand AI data centers for training and deploying advanced AI models, will see its costs rise to $400 billion as it progresses.

title: Trump Cancels Meeting on Gov Shutdown, Blames Democrats

summary: Former President Donald Trump canceled a meeting aimed at preventing a federal government shutdown, blaming Congressional Democrats for the impasse. He accused them of losing their way in a post on Truth Social. New York Democrats Senator Chuck Schumer and Representative Hakeem Jeffries countered by stating Trump would be blamed for the shutdown, criticizing him for avoiding negotiations. The potential shutdown threatens federal workers' pay, air travel, and food stamp distribution.

title: MLB to Introduce ABS Challenge System for Calls in 2026
snippets: NEW YORK — Starting next season, MLB players will be able to challenge balls and strikes a few times per game. A vote on Tuesday approved the Automated Ball-Strike (ABS) Challenge System, which had been tested in the minor leagues, at spring training and during this summer’s MLB All-Star Game. The r
The automated balls and strikes challenge system will officially be part of all MLB Spring Training, regular season, and postseason starting in 2026. Here's the details
Major league players will be allowed to challenge ball and strike calls beginning in 2026.
titles: MLB approves ball-strike challenge system for 2026 season
Automated Balls And Strikes System Coming To MLB In 2026
MLB approves ball-strike challenges beginning in 2026
summary: Starting in 2026, MLB players will have the ability to challenge ball and strike calls during games, following a successful vote to implement the Automated Ball-Strike (ABS) Challenge System. This system, previously tested in minor leagues, spring training, and the MLB All-Star Game, will be applied in Spring Training, regular season, and postseason games.

title: YouTube to Allow Banned Misinformation Channels to Seek Reinstatement
snippets: YouTube on Tuesday said it will allow previously banned accounts to apply for reinstatement, rolling back a policy that had treated violations as permanent.

Google has announced it will reverse a major content moderation decision: YouTube will offer channels that were banned for spreading covid and election misinformation in 2020 a pathway back onto the platform. In a letter sent to the House Judiciary Committee, Alphabet's lawyers claimed that the Bide
Alphabet blames the Biden administration for its moderation decisions.
titles: YouTube to allow creators banned for Covid-19, election misinformation to apply for reinstatement
YouTube will let creators who spread covid misinformation back on the site
YouTube will restore channels banned for COVID and election misinformation
summary: YouTube, owned by Alphabet, announced it will enable channels banned for spreading COVID-19 and election misinformation in 2020 to apply for reinstatement. This marks a reversal of its prior policy treating such violations as permanent. The decision was disclosed in a letter to the House Judiciary Committee, where Alphabet suggested the Biden administration influenced its moderation policies.

title: NASA's Artemis II to Orbit Moon in 2026, Eyes Lunar Landing in 2027
snippets: The mission around the Moon will pave the way for a lunar landing as soon as 2027.
The crew of Artemis II will not land on the moon but will lay the groundwork for the first crewed missions to Mars.
NASA on Tuesday said it was on track to send astronauts to orbit the moon in early 2026, as the United States races China to return to the lunar surface.
titles: Nasa to send first crewed mission around Moon in 50 years
NASA plans to send manned Moon mission by February 2026
NASA says on track to send astronauts around the Moon in 2026
summary: NASA announced plans for the Artemis II mission to orbit the Moon in early 2026, setting the stage for a lunar landing in 2027 and future crewed missions to Mars. This mission aims to establish groundwork for further space exploration as the US competes with China in returning to the lunar surface.

title: Trump's Vaccine and Tylenol Remarks Stir Controversy
snippets: Scientific evidence is lacking to support the US government’s decisions to caution against using a common painkiller in pregnancy and fast-track the approval of an experimental medication for autism

Many doctors and scientists were reeling Monday after President Donald Trump went on TV to insist that pregnant women should never take Tylenol and revive debunked theories about vaccines and autism. Trump went beyond his own Food and Drug Administration’s more modest advice that doctors “should con
titles: What we know, and don't, about the link between painkillers and autism
What we know about autism’s causes and any potential link to Tylenol
summary: President Donald Trump's statements on TV advising against the use of Tylenol by pregnant women and reviving debunked theories about vaccines and autism have sparked controversy. These statements go beyond the FDA's more cautious advice, leading to confusion and concern among doctors and scientists. There is a lack of scientific evidence to support the U.S. government's caution against Tylenol in pregnancy and the fast-tracking of an experimental autism medication.

The 29-year-old reality TV star, who won Love Island in 2018 and t
titles: Dani Dyer pulls out of Strictly with broken ankle
Dani Dyer-Bowen leaves Strictly Come Dancing after fracturing ankle in rehearsal
summary: Dani Dyer-Bowen, a former Love Island winner, has withdrawn from the 23rd series of Strictly Come Dancing due to a fractured ankle sustained during rehearsal. She reported the injury occurred after landing awkwardly in training. Despite her withdrawal, Dyer-Bowen expressed heartbreak over the situation but promised to return to support the remaining cast.

title: Trump Urges NATO to Shoot Down Russian Jets After Poland Incident
snippets: US President Donald Trump says NATO countries should shoot down Russian aircraft that violate their airspace.
Trump made the comments after Poland became the first member nation to fire at Russian aircraft earlier this month since the start of the Russia-Ukraine war.
titles: Trump: NATO countries should shoot down Russian aircraft violating airspace
Trump Says NATO Countries Should Shoot Down Russian Aircraft, Contradicting Rubio
summary: US President Donald Trump suggested that NATO countries should shoot down Russian aircraft entering their airspace, following an incident where Poland, a NATO member, fired at a Russian aircraft. This marks the first such action by a NATO country against Russia since the onset of the Russia-Ukraine conflict.

title: NASA Eyes Crewed Artemis Moon Flight Within 20 Weeks
snippets: After multiple delays, the first crewed Artemis flight around the moon could be less than 20 weeks away, NASA officials said Tuesday, putting the space program one step closer to returning to the moon itself in its "second space race" with China.
"There is a desire for us to be the first to return to the surface of the Moon."
titles: NASA officials say Artemis II moon flight could come in early February
NASA targeting early February for Artemis II mission to the Moon
summary: NASA officials announced that the first crewed Artemis flight around the moon could occur in less than 20 weeks, advancing the space agency's goal to return to the lunar surface and stay ahead in the space race with China. This development brings NASA one step closer to its objective of returning humans to the moon.

title: Jessica Chastain's "The Savant" Pulled from Apple TV+ Schedule
snippets:
The Savant pulled from Apple TV+ release schedule ‘after careful consideration’

Jessica Chastain-led series The Savant has been pulled from the Apple TV+ release schedule.

The thriller was set to begin on 26 September but its release has been postponed.

The Savant, the upcoming Apple TV Plus show about law enforcement working to prevent domestic terrorism, was slated to premiere this Friday. But the streamer has quietly pulled the series from its release slate and it’s not clear if or when it will now debut. Based on Andrea Stanley’s 20
titles: Apple postpones Jessica Chastain series about domestic extremism

summary: The Savant, a thriller series led by Jessica Chastain and focused on preventing domestic terrorism, was scheduled to premiere on Apple TV+ on September 26. However, after careful consideration, the show has been removed from the release schedule, and it is currently unclear if or when it will debut.

title: Drone Strike at Haiti Party Kills 8 Children, Mistargets Gang Leader
snippets: A drone meant to strike a gang leader hit a celebration where children had gathered. Haiti is using drones to repel gangs that control much of the capital.

Six others were injured after drone explosions in Cité Soleil, where an alleged gang leader was distributing gifts

At least eight children were killed and six others seriously injured in a drone attack on a birthday party in Haiti’s capi
titles: Drone Strike in Haiti Kills 8 Children at a Birthday Party
Haiti: at least eight children among 13 killed in drone attack on birthday party
summary: In Haiti, a drone attack intended to target a gang leader mistakenly struck a birthday party in Cité Soleil, resulting in the death of at least eight children and serious injuries to six others. The incident occurred as the country employs drones to combat gangs dominating the capital.

title: Online Retail Giant to Close 19 Shops, 5 to Become Whole Foods
snippets: The online retail giant says it would convert five of the 19 shops into Whole Foods stores.
The company's grocery business has undergone significant changes over the past few years, including trimming its brick-and-mortar store footprint.

summary: An online retail giant announced plans to close 19 shops, with five being converted into Whole Foods stores, as part of a strategy adjustment following the unsuccessful adoption of its till-less store concept. This move reflects significant changes in the company's approach to its grocery business, which has seen a reduction in its physical store presence recently.

title: Disney to Raise Prices Amid Subscription Drop
snippets: Customers will see price increases on October 21, Disney said.

The timing of the price increases isn’t ideal, as Disney+ subscribers canceled their subscriptions in droves last week, protesting Disney’s decision to temporarily pull Jimmy Kimmel from its airwaves.

Disney is raising the price of Disney+, Hulu subscriptions next month
summary: Disney announced that prices will rise on October 21. This follows a significant drop in Disney+ subscriptions last week, attributed to the company's temporary removal of Jimmy Kimmel from its programming.

title: Ragasa: World's Strongest Storm Causes Deaths, Disruptions in Asia
snippets: Ragasa is the strongest storm anywhere on Earth so far this year.
Two people were reported dead in Taiwan, with dozens missing. Hong Kong canceled flights, Macau shut casinos and Shenzhen planned to evacuate 400,000 people.
titles: Typhoon bursts Taiwan lake as  strongest storm barrels towards China
Typhoon Ragasa Floods Taiwan and Barrels Toward China’s Coast
summary: Ragasa, the year's strongest storm globally, has caused significant disruptions and fatalities. In Taiwan, it resulted in two deaths and numerous missing persons. Hong Kong responded by canceling flights, Macau closed its casinos, and Shenzhen is evacuating 400,000 residents due to the storm's impact.

title: Tech Leaders to Discuss AI, Space Economy, and Startups at TechCrunch Disrupt 20
snippets: At TechCrunch Disrupt 2025, True Anomaly’s Even Rogers and Vast’s Max Haot will join the Space Stage to explore what’s needed to unlock a sustainable and scalable space economy.

On the AI Stage at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025, Mercor co-founder and CEO Brendan Foody will break down how artificial intelligence is transforming not just how we work, but also who gets to work in the first place.

Vinod Khosla, founder of Khosla Ventures, takes the Disrupt Stage for a candid fireside chat on AI, climate, healthcare, and transformational startups. Hear blunt, big-picture advice from one of tech’s most legendary investors, and learn what founders truly need to succeed in turbulent times.
titles: Building the new backbone of space at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
Mercor’s Brendan Foody breaks down AI’s impact on hiring at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
Vinod Khosla on AI, moonshots, and building enduring startups — all at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
summary: At TechCrunch Disrupt 2025, leaders in technology and investment, including Even Rogers, Max Haot, Brendan Foody, and Vinod Khosla, will discuss key topics shaping the future. They'll cover the development of a sustainable space economy, the impact of AI on employment, and the role of startups in addressing major global challenges such as climate change and healthcare. The event aims to provide insights into creating successful ventures in a rapidly changing world.

title: Morrissey, The Strokes Announce US, Canada, Mexico Tours; Tickets Available
snippets: Despite some setbacks, Morrissey will be performing across the US, Canada, Mexico, and more. Here's how to get tickets.
The Strokes are returning to the stage for a brief tour before hitting Austin City Limits and Coachella. Here's how to get tickets.
titles: How to get Morrissey concert tickets: Tour dates in Los Angeles, San Antonio, and more
How to get The Strokes concert tickets: Las Vegas, El Paso, Austin, and Indio
summary: Morrissey and The Strokes are both set to perform in upcoming tours across the US, Canada, Mexico, and other locations, despite some setbacks for Morrissey. Morrissey's tour details and ticket information are available, while The Strokes will tour briefly before appearing at Austin City Limits and Coachella, with ticket information also provided for their shows.
